alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:59PM EST until February 18 at 4:32PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Knox, Lee, Owsley, Perry and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated showers containing rainfall rates up to an inch per hour at times moving across the area. Rainfall amounts between 8 and 10 pm will range from 0.5 inches to an inch. This will cause minor flooding in low lying areas and lead to overflowing culverts in places. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Barbourville, Jackson, Beattyville, Manchester, Campton, Booneville, Simpson, Fincastle, Buckhorn, Mill Pond, Tanksley, Bernice, Laurel Creek, Wild Cat, Treadway, Fall Rock, Littleton, Hensley and Ammie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Perry
